entry.title: Movie: Dunkirk, by Christopher Nolan (2017)
entry.content:
Movie: Dunkirk, by Christopher Nolan (2017)20180430
This was a very striking movie. I loved how silent and plodding it
was. It did an amazing job of taking a very small topic and showing
it excellently.
  • Movies
  • 2017

entry.title: Movie: The Avengers, directed by Joss Whedon (2012) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: The Avengers, directed by Joss Whedon (2012) (2)20180430
I'm surprised that I have not re-watched this movie in so long. It
is really excellent and it does an amazing job of having everyone
face a struggle but then come back and work together well. It is
very surprising in retrospect, how capable Hawk-Eye and Black Widow
are given that they are not actually super powered. The fight
scenes are so good!
  • Movies
  • 2012

entry.title: Movie: Captain America, starring Chris Evans (2011) (3)
entry.content:
Movie: Captain America, starring Chris Evans (2011) (3)20180430
I love the warm-hearted-ness of this movie and the whole training
sequence as Steve becomes Captain America. The action part takes
place really quickly, but I like how naturally he develops a combat
style.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 4 - Episode 1 - Two Swords (4)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 4 - Episode 1 - Two Swords (4)20180430
Tyrion is really on point in this episode... so much revolves
around him. I love how much is set up instantly in this first
episode for the season. I am very excited about Jon and Arya's
plot-lines this season. Joffrey is such a punk. I love Arya's and
the Hound's lines. You really see her discovering the new
identity she eventually gains.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Movie: Thor, starring Chris Hemsworth (2011) (2)
entry.content:
Movie: Thor, starring Chris Hemsworth (2011) (2)20180426
This is such an excellent movie. It is right up there with the
original Iron Man in how well it introduces the character and the
world. I love all the scenes between Jane and Thor, they work so
well together. I'm not sure if it is just because Natalie Portman
is so amazing. The visual effects in this are really great and it
creates such a different, stunning world.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Movie: The Incredible Hulk, starring Edward Norton (2008)
entry.content:
Movie: The Incredible Hulk, starring Edward Norton (2008)20180424
I enjoyed this movie, although it was very strange how it told the
story of Bruce becoming Hulk outside of the movie. It is also kind
of sad that the movie did so poorly that Norton lost the role and
all the ideas in it were dropped for later editions of the Hulk
character.
  • Movies
  • 2008

entry.title: Game: Sakura Arms (Board, 2017) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Sakura Arms (Board, 2017) (3)20180418
I spent some time learning about each character.

Yukihi --- Her umbrella state switches between different
attacks. Closed attacks from mid-range, while Open stacks from
very close range. Closed in general is a defensive posture (can
move further back), while Open is the aggressive one. Gentle Snow
is very useful with a closed umbrella because you can get back as
many times as you want. Abrupt Transformation lets you surprise
switching states. In general, lots of attacks.

Shinra --- A few attacks that are very wide range, but mostly
deals status effects. Prove the Nature is a really weird
card... when combined with Infer the Totality though, then you can
avoid dying, but it doesn't seem like it will do a lot of damage.

Oboro --- Playing a discard Trap seems like it could be useful,
especially with Caltrop and Steel Strings. This would synergize
well with Yukihi, who attacks from a similar range. Kuma-Suke
(attack a number of times equal to Discard cards) could be pretty
powerful, especially at the short range.

Yurina --- She has a really wide range and Spirit of Fire is a
great thing to do at the end when your life is low. Very powerful
attacks as Specials.

Saine --- Silent Wall is pretty essential as a way to keep nothing
on your Aura but still defend. Rhythmic Arc is definitely
powerful.

Himika --- Long distance attacks and very cheap Specials.

Tokoyo --- Very defensive with almost no attacks. Very good at the
mid-range and essential to have Vigor 2 because of the special
trait.

Hmm, that was interesting. I'm excited to play again.

Total time: 2:42
  • Video Games
  • Sakura Arms
  • Board
  • 2017

entry.title: Game: Sakura Arms (Board, 2017) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Sakura Arms (Board, 2017) (2)20180417
My son and I played. My son played the defensive started deck,
while I randomly chose a team and got Shuriken & Gun, then
randomly chose cards. It was a really bad set up because I did not
get many attack cards and just hard awful symmetry. We had a lot
of fun and he beat me. I think it was a good way to start so he'd
have some confidence.

Total time: 2:11

entry.title: Game: Sakura Arms (Board, 2017)
entry.content:
Game: Sakura Arms (Board, 2017)20180414
I played the example decks against myself. It was really cool. The
second player would have lost because they had to reshuffle their
deck and had one life left. On one hand, that feels like a lame
way to die, but I did discard from her a lot, so it is definitely
my fault. I played through their turn though to see what I would
have done and they were able to kill the first player. This is
cool because it means that the two initial decks are really well
balanced if I could basically beat either one with the other.

Wow, the cards are SO beautiful and the style of the game is
amazing. I love this. Now, how can I convince my wife to learn how
to play?

Total time: 1:04
  • Video Games
  • Sakura Arms
  • Board
  • 2017

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 3 - Episode 10 - Mhysa (4)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 3 - Episode 10 - Mhysa (4)20180414
It is amazing to me how every episode can be so monumental in the
things that it sets up. Now, a lot of that can only be told
because I've seen the whole show before, but it is fascinating
nevertheless. Every character in this episode had crazy, life
changing things happen. I think my favorite is Arya realizing
that she wants to be a Faceless Man.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game: Odin Sphere: Leifthrasir (PS4, 2016)
entry.content:
Game: Odin Sphere: Leifthrasir (PS4, 2016)20180412
I started this and did three chapters of the Valkyrie story. This
game is great. I really enjoy the improvements from the PS2
version. (I rented the PS2 one but had a really hard time playing
because of the need of harvesting plants during the battle.) I
think that mechanics of Muramasa are slightly better, but the
variety of this, especially in the different skills and characters
is really great. I'm having a blast so far!

Total time: 2:13
  • Video Games
  • Odin Sphere: Leifthrasir
  • PS4
  • 2016
